channel.title: FOXBusiness.com
channel.description: FOX Business Network - The Power to Prosper

item.title: Bolivia and China Ink Lithium Exploration Deal
item.description: Bolivia signed an agreement with China International Trust and Investment Corporation, or Citic, for the Asian company to conduct lithium exploration in Bolivia's Coipasa salt flats, Bolivian state news service ABI reported Wednesday.

item.title: Argentine Official Says Mining Doesn't Threaten Glaciers
item.description: --Environmentalists charge that some mining projects violate glacier protection law

item.title: Obama, Bernanke Talk Jobs, Recovery, Debt, Europe
item.description: WASHINGTON - President Barack Obama and Federal Reserve Board Chairman Ben Bernanke discussed the economy and the global recovery in a meeting Wednesday, the White House said. The two discussed the outlook for the recovery and for jobs as well as long-term deficit reduction, the White House said. Bernanke and Obama also discussed the situation in Europe. This is the third meeting between Bernanke and Obama this year. The meeting comes one day after the Fed promised to keep its benchmark interest rate near zero until mid-2013 in light of a downgrade of the U.S. economic outlook.

item.title: Steelmaker Gerdau Studies Move Into Rail Production In Brazil
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO -(Dow Jones)- Latin America's largest steelmaker, Gerdau SA (GGBR4.BR) said it is studying a move into rail production in Brazil.

item.title: Cisco's Q4 beats Street view, focus on outlook
item.description: By Noel Randewich

item.title: Fear Rushes Back: Euro Woes, Economic Malaise Incite Violent Selling
item.description: The rollercoaster ride on Wall Street continued for yet another day as economic jitters and euro-zone fears crushed equities and sent the blue chips spiraling 520 points.
item.dc:creator: Adam Samson

item.title: 20 Largest Point Declines in Dow's History
item.description: Stocks were again crushed on Wednesday amid ongoing fears of economic turmoil in the U.S. and abroad. The Dow closed down by 519.83 points, which ranks as the ninth-worst selloff ever. Here are the largest 20 selloffs, on a points basis, in the history of the Dow.

item.title: Argentina, China In Talks To Build $750 Million Copper Refinery - Official
item.description: -Argentine officials in talks with Chinese companies to build copper refinery.

item.title: Perupetro Hopes To Launch Concession Auction Before Year-End
item.description: --Peru's oil exploration license agency aims to auction 14 blocks

item.title: U.S. budget gap hits $1.1 trillion to date
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States is running a $1.1 trillion budget deficit to date in the current fiscal year, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday, as lawmakers began to seek extra cuts in public spending to rein in debt.

item.title: Analysis: Debt deal, downgrade add to view of waning U.S. power
item.description: By Arshad Mohammed

item.title: Fiscal 2011 Budget Deficit Hits $1.1T
item.description: The United States budget gap has hit $1.1 trillionin the current fiscal year, the Treasury said on Wednesday.

item.title: Chile CMPC 2Q Net Profit Rises To $166.9 Million From $122.2 Million
item.description: SANTIAGO -(Dow Jones)- Chilean pulp and wood products company Empresas CMPC SA's (CMPC.SN) second-quarter net profit increased 36.5% on the year to $166.9 million as international wood pulp prices increases and sales volumes expanded, the company said Wednesday in a filing with the SVS local securities regulator.

item.title: Citi, BofA, Goldman lead financial stock swoon
item.description: CHARLOTTE, North Carolina (Reuters) - The shares of Bank of America Corp <BAC.N>, Citigroup Inc <C.N>, Goldman Sachs Group Inc <GS.N> and Morgan Stanley <MS.N> skidded on Wednesday, renewing evidence that when the market sneezes financial stocks get pneumonia.

item.title: Moody's: Some States, Cities Could Face Stress
item.description: Moody's said most state and local governments that issue debt in the U.S. municipal bond market are "well insulated from shock," but some could be weakened during market volatility.

item.title: Market Fear Driving Dividend Stock-And-Options Plays
item.description: NEW YORK -(Dow Jones)- Cash-rich companies such as Pfizer Inc. (PFE) and Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ) offer not only attractive dividend yields but, thanks to an increasingly skittish market, a way to leverage those gains farther through the use of options.

item.title: Obama Will Meet With Bernanke Later Wednesday
item.description: WASHINGTON - President Barack Obama and his top economic advisors will meet with Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke later on Wednesday, White House spokesman Jay Carney said. Carney said the economy has been weaker than White House economists had expected. He said there was no expectation of another recession. "We...continue to believe that the economy will keep growing," Carney said. On Tuesday, the Fed downgraded its assessment of the economic outlook and pledged to keep its benchmark rate near zero. Stocks have sunk in part on the Fed's gloomy outlook. Obama and Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner remain in close touch with European leaders about the ongoing financial tensions in the U.S. and the euro-zone.

item.title: White House seeks ideas to shrink foreclosure glut
item.description: By Margaret Chadbourn

item.title: S&P, Moody's Reaffirm France's AAA Rating: Report
item.description: BOSTON -- Standard & Poor's, Moody's Investors Service, and Fitch Ratings all reaffirmed their AAA credit ratings for France early Wednesday, according to a Bloomberg News report. Bloomberg said that S&P's managing director of European sovereign ratings told the wire service that France's outlook was stable and warranted an AAA rating. Spokesmen for Moody's and Fitch also reiterated their respective ratings of AAA with stable outlooks, Bloomberg added.

item.title: Brazil MMX: Buying Iron Ore From Neighboring Mines To Meet Export Schedule
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO -(Dow Jones)- Brazilian iron ore miner MMX Mineracao e Metalicos SA (MMXM3.BR) is buying iron ore from third party suppliers on the Brazilian domestic market to meet demand from its international customers, Chief Executive Roger Downey said Wednesday.
